meanings.definition: relating to or affecting the sclera of the eye
meanings.sent1: The scleral injection caused redness in the eye.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the scleral tissue for any abnormalities.
meanings.sent3: The scleral glasses made him look like a science fiction character.
meanings.sent4: Her scleral gaze seemed to pierce through his excuses.
meanings.sent5: The scleral color of his eyes was a striking shade of blue.

meanings.definition: a white fibrous membrane that forms the outer layer of the eyeball
meanings.sent1: The scleral protects the inner parts of the eye.
meanings.sent2: She noticed a tiny scratch on her scleral while looking in the mirror.
meanings.sent3: The clown's oversized glasses had colorful sclerals that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The moon hung in the sky like a giant scleral watching over the night.
meanings.sent5: The scleral felt smooth and cool to the touch during the eye exam.
